Patent Information.Abstract: Antifungal proteins which are analogues of the Rs-AFP2 protein and contain particular mutations in their amino acid sequence. The mutated proteins possess enhanced salt-tolerant antifungal activity. The proteins are useful for combating fungal diseases in agricultural, pharmaceutical or preservative applications.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Raphanus sativus Antifungal Protein 3 (Rs-AFP3; Plant defensin)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Alternaria brassicicola (MIC=2 µg/ml), Botrytis cinerea (MIC=2 µg/ml), Fusarium culmorum (MIC=2 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Possesses antifungal activity sensitive to inorganic cations (By similarity).

Literature.Title: Small cysteine-rich antifungal proteins from radish their role in host defense.
Literature.Author: Terras FR, Eggermont K, Kovaleva V, Raikhel NV, Osborn RW, Kester A, Rees SB, Torrekens S, Van Leuven F, Vanderleyden J, et al.

Literature.Title: A new family of basic cysteine-rich plant antifungal proteins from Brassicaceae species.
Literature.Author: Terras FR, Torrekens S, Van Leuven F, Osborn RW, Vanderleyden J, Cammue BP, Broekaert WF.
